slides.title: Welcome to Indian Navy
slides.content:
**About Indian Navy**

**Mission:** Combat-ready, credible, cohesive and future-proof force

**Motto:** Śaṁ No Varuṇaḥ (May the Lord of waters be auspicious)

**Navy Day:** December 4 (Operation Trident 1971)

**Founded:** Modern Indian Navy - 26 January 1950

**Strength:** ~67,000 personnel, 150+ ships, 300+ aircraft

**Role:** Maritime borders, sea lanes, humanitarian assistance

slides.title: Naval Ranks - Sailors
slides.content:
**Your Career Path**

**Master Chief Petty Officer (MCPO):** Most senior
**Chief Petty Officer (CPO):** Senior technical
**Petty Officer (PO):** Supervisor
**Leading Seaman (LS):** Team leader
**Seaman First Class:** Experienced
**Seaman Second Class:** Entry level

Progress through performance, exams, training

slides.title: Major Ships
slides.content:
**Aircraft Carriers:**
INS Vikrant (2022, indigenous), INS Vikramaditya

**Destroyers:** Kolkata class, Visakhapatnam class

**Submarines:**
Nuclear: INS Arihant, Arighat
Conventional: Kalvari class (Scorpene)

**Commands:** Western (Mumbai), Eastern (Visakhapatnam), Southern (Kochi)

slides.title: Defense Forces
slides.content:
**Army:** 1.2M, Land warfare, Army Day Jan 15
**Air Force:** 140K, Air warfare, AF Day Oct 8
**Navy:** 67K, Maritime, Navy Day Dec 4

**CDS:** Chief of Defence Staff coordinates all
**Para-military:** BSF, CRPF, CISF, ITBP, Coast Guard

question.questionText: When is Indian Navy Day celebrated?
question.explanation: Indian Navy Day is December 4, commemorating Operation Trident 1971.
